creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org
text:
The WMF painter supports only about half the charsets which are listed in
WinGDI.h.  The rest should ideally be added.

creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org
text:
Created attachment 19290
Patch to add missing charsets / encodings

The mappings for the missing charsets were taken from a page on Mozilla's site
somewhere.

creator: herve.girod@club-internet.fr
text:
Did you test this patch. I don't thing it could work, because I added only
charsets that are supported on the standard JRE, the other charsets are not (or
so I think)

(In reply to comment #2)
> Did you test this patch. I don't thing it could work, because I added only
> charsets that are supported on the standard JRE, the other charsets are not (or
> so I think) 
My previous comment was maybe a bit cryptic. I was the one who proposed the
original patch to propose more than the sole ANSI charset)
creator: herve.girod@club-internet.fr

text:
I did test this for one charset (Shift_JIS, the one which I happened to have a 
test file for.)  The "standard" JRE offers an option to include more charsets, 
which is useful for this.

If your JRE is lacking the charset, it will catch the 
UnsupportedEncodingException just like before, and return the same result as 
the original code.
creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org
herve.girod@club-internet.fr
text:
(In reply to comment #4)
> I did test this for one charset (Shift_JIS, the one which I happened to have a 
> test file for.)  The "standard" JRE offers an option to include more charsets, 
> which is useful for this.
> 
> If your JRE is lacking the charset, it will catch the 
> UnsupportedEncodingException just like before, and return the same result as 
> the original code.

So I think that's OK !!

Hi Trejkaz,
  Is there any chance of getting a Contributors License Agreement (CLA),
so we can accept the patch?

   http://www.apache.org/licenses/#clas
creator: deweese@apache.org

text:
I submitted one some time ago when another Apache project asked the same 
thing.  Presumably it would still be on record.
creator: trejkaz@trypticon.org

text:
(In reply to comment #7)
> I submitted one some time ago when another Apache project asked the same 
> thing.  Presumably it would still be on record.

   That's great! What name is it under?

   I checked the list for obvious derivations of 'Trejkaz' and
couldn't match it.  Thanks.
creator: deweese@apache.org
trejkaz@trypticon.org
text:
Aha... true enough.  It's under "Daniel Noll".  I wondered if I had an email 
address attached to it which did contain the other name.

Trejkaz thanks for working with us.
Your patch has been applied, many thanks!
creator: deweese@apache.org
